medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In the first case, the patient presented with chest pain for 12 hours leading to the first myocardial infarction at age 40; he experienced an acute coronary syndrome 3.5 years later. In the second case, a 53-year-old man presented with substernal chest pain and a peak troponin of 30 ng/mL, indicating multivessel coronary artery disease.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of coronary artery disease.
